executive_summary: Organic crop farmers don't use pesticides or genetically modified organisms (GMOs). They grow vegetables, fruits, corn, wheat, soybeans, mushrooms and other types of food. Farmers benefited from rising wages in the years before the pandemic, as rising incomes enabled more consumers to afford more expensive organic food, so demand for the industry's products increased.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: High Wages Have Boosted Revenue Recently
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In the years immediately preceding the pandemic, high economic growth caused wages to surge. High wages raised incomes, which enabled consumers to purchase expensive products such as organic foods. Since demand for organic products was high, revenue grew significantly in 2018 and 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The COVID-19 Pandemic Reduced Downstream Demand for Farmers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When the pandemic hit, many manufacturers, retailers and other businesses were forced to shut down. Food processors and grocery stores weren't shut down because they sold essential goods. Mask-wearing and social distancing laws reduced the manufacturing and selling capacity of these companies. Since grocery stores and food processors displayed lower capacity, demand for organic produce declined, causing revenue to drop in 2020.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Agricultural Prices Soared During the Pandemic's Recovery
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As businesses opened up during the recovery from the pandemic, demand for various products surged. Since producers reduced their capacity during the pandemic, demand outstripped supply significantly, causing agricultural prices to skyrocket. Organic farmers generate more income per sale when input prices are higher, so revenue surged in 2021 and 2022 because of very high agricultural prices.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Interest Rates Have Constrained Farming Capacity
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: To combat high inflation, the Federal Reserve has been increasing interest rates recently. As the cost of borrowing has risen, it's become more difficult for organic crop farmers to purchase machinery, land and other capital necessary to grow more produce, reducing revenue growth significantly in 2023. Higher interest rates have also cooled the economy, reduced agricultural prices and further hampered revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: FALLING AGRICULTURAL PRICES ARE EXPECTED TO REDUCE A KEY REVENUE STREAM FOR THE INDUSTRY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Agricultural prices are expected to fall during the outlook period, as supply chain pressures during the pandemic recovery will completely cease. Spending on agricultural products from China will also fall, constraining overall demand for US-grown products. Lower agricultural prices will reduce income per sale for organic crop farmers, which will cause revenue during the outlook period to drop.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: LOWER FRUIT AND VEGETABLE CONSUMPTION WILL LIKELY INHIBIT SALES OF ORGANIC PRODUCE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Volatile weather patterns will discourage farmers from planting fruits and vegetables, reducing their per capita consumption. Lower fruit and vegetable consumption will constrain organic crop farmers' ability to make sales, causing revenue to fall.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: RISING INCOMES WILL LIKELY BOOST DEMAND FOR FARMERS' PRODUCTS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite challenges related to high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, the economy is anticipated to hold up well during the outlook period. Modest GDP growth will cause per capita disposable incomes to increase slightly in the near future. Rising incomes will enable consumers to pay for more expensive products such as organic food, so demand for organic produce will increase, aiding revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: HIGHER OBESITY RATES ARE EXPECTED TO MAKE CONSUMERS MORE HEALTH CONSCIOUS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The obesity rate will likely increase over the next five years. Since the deleterious effects of being overweight are well-known, more individuals will try to lose weight when the obesity rate rises. Organic fruits and vegetables are often advertised as being healthy, so obese individuals wanting to lose weight will purchase more of them, boosting the industry's performance.

industry_definition: Farmers in this industry grow organic crops. Organic crops are certified by the US Department of Agriculture and don't use manufactured fertilizers, pesticides, growth regulators or any other plant modifications.
key_trends: Organic farmers generate more income per sale when input prices are higher
In the years immediately preceding the pandemic, high economic growth caused wages to surge
To combat high inflation, the Federal Reserve has been increasing interest rates recently
Agricultural prices are expected to fall during the outlook period
Rising incomes will enable consumers to pay for more expensive products such as organic food
The obesity rate will likely increase over the next five years

market_segmentation.segment: Food Stores are Essential Buyers of Organic Produce
market_segmentation.segment_description: Organic crop farmers generate nearly two-thirds of their revenue from grocery stores, restaurants and other retailers. These stores purchase organic food because they can bundle the industry's products all in one place for households to purchase. As the economy has recovered from the COVID-19 pandemic, demand from retail trade has surged, boosting food stores' revenue share during the current period.

market_segmentation.segment: Farmers Markets Sell Produce Directly to Consumers
market_segmentation.segment_description: Farmers sometimes directly sell their products directly to consumers, as households often think they're the freshest. People were less likely to go to farmers markets during the pandemic, as they didn't want to risk getting COVID-19. Direct purchases from households fell, as did consumers' revenue share during the current period.

market_segmentation.segment: Food Processors Comprise a Small Share of Revenue
market_segmentation.segment_description: Food processors purchase organic produce to make fruit juices and other products out of them. Since organic food is expensive, it's not cost-effective to purchase the industry's products, so processors comprise less than a quarter of revenue. Business growth has lagged because of the COVID-19 pandemic, so fewer food processors have been propping up, reducing their revenue share during the current period.

products_and_services.product_or_service: POOR EATING HAS CONSTRAINED DEMAND FOR ORGANIC VEGETABLES
products_and_services.product_description: Organic vegetables aren't grown with pesticides and include tomatoes, potatoes, lettuce and carrots. The healthy eating index has grown slowly in recent years, as households indulged in snacks during the pandemic.

products_and_services.product_or_service: HIGH FRUIT PRICES HAVE NEGATIVELY IMPACTED SPENDING ON ORGANIC FRUITS, NUTS AND BERRIES
products_and_services.product_description: Farmers sell organic apples, grapes, strawberries, blueberries, raspberries and various forms of nuts to households. These fruits have become more expensive in recent years, as adverse weather conditions increased prices. Higher prices have constrained spending on organic fruits, nuts and berries, so their revenue share has decreased during the current period.

products_and_services.product_or_service: SPENDING ON ORGANIC FIELD CROPS IS DEPENDENT ON THE WHOLESALING INDUSTRY
products_and_services.product_description: Organic field crops include corn, cotton, hay, soybeans and other high-value crops that don't use pesticides. Corn, wheat and soybean wholesalers performed well during the pandemic recovery, as renewed demand for these products boosted their revenue. Since the selling of field crops has surged in recent years, demand for organic field crops has risen also, boosting their share of revenue during the current period.
The remaining segments and their percentages are not provided in the given content.

tier_2_suppliers: Electric Power Transmission in the US
Coal & Natural Gas Power in the US
tier_1_buyers: Canned Fruit & Vegetable Processing in the US
Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US
Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US
tier_2_buyers: Animal Food Production in the US
Fruit & Vegetable Markets in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand for organic crops, vegetables and fruits is mainly determined by consumer health trends and agricultural prices.
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Spending on organic produce has been steadily rising for the past two decades as more emphasis has been given to the health and environmental benefits of organic farming.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Many non-organic crops have trace amounts of pesticides when sold.
demand_determinants.determinant_description: While these low levels of chemicals have been deemed safe, some consumers consider organic products to be safer.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Agricultural prices are crucial in determining demand for organic produce.
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Organic products are typically sold at a higher price than non-organic products because organic farms have more significant operating costs and lower production volumes.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Supply Chain Disruptions Hurt Imports During the COVID-19 Pandemic
international_trade_points.trade_description: When the COVID-19 pandemic hit, governments put stringent restrictions on trade to ensure the virus wouldn't spread throughout the world.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The Declining Dollar Will Reduce Intake From Abroad
international_trade_points.trade_description: The US dollar will depreciate during the outlook period, making foreign goods more expensive relative to domestically grown crops.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) Enables the Spread of Organic Food Throughout North America
international_trade_points.trade_description: The USMCA became effective in 2020 and reduced many trade barriers between the United States, Canada and Mexico.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Recovery from the Pandemic Has Boosted Global Demand for Organic Produce
international_trade_points.trade_description: As economies abroad recovered from the pandemic, consumer spending worldwide surged.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports to China Remain Essential Despite the Recent Trade War
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports of organic food to China continued to climb despite the trade war.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The USDA regulates organic crop farmers by forcing them to be certified to grow organic produce.
The USDA partners with the Animal and Plant Inspection Service (APHIS) to ensure that imported organic foods are safe for humans and animals to eat.
Organic crop farmers are regulated at the local level.
The EPA regulates organic crop farmers in a variety of ways.
Similar to most industries, organic crop farmers must adhere to the regulations set out by OSHA.
Since organic crop farming was necessary in many respects, their businesses weren't shut down during COVID-19.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Farmers must receive certification and accreditation from the USDA.
Initial costs are heavy, as heavy investment in land, machinery, seeds and organic fertilizers is required.
Organic crop farmers differentiate themselves by establishing a strong reputation through consistent word-of-mouth recommendations over time.

basis_points.basis_description: Organic crop farmers display a moderate level of competition based on location, price and product variety.
Organic farms contend with significant competition from non-organic farms.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Family Farms Have Held a Strong Reputation Among Their Buyers
concentration_points.concentration_description: Agriculture in the United States is often dominated by small farms.

concentration_points.concentration_title: High Costs Make It Difficult for Organic Farms to Expand
concentration_points.concentration_description: Wages, rent, and utilities are expensive.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Depreciation includes expenses for repairing equipment.
Marketing is projected to comprise 0.7% of revenue.
Rent is forecast to comprise 8.2% of revenue.
Utilities are expected to make up 7.5% of revenue.
Other costs include insurance and administrative fees.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Organic crop farmers have a high level of capital intensity.

volatility_points.volatility_description: When agricultural prices are high, farmers receive more revenue per sale.

volatility_points.volatility_title: High Incomes Are Necessary To Maintain Demand For Organic Produce
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for organic foods corresponds to consumer income levels.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Organic crop farms have low technological disruption.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The technology used in organic farming
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Organic farming technology differs from non-organic technologies.

FAQs.question: Do your sales depend on the overall health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Demand for organic produce tends to be stable, as sales depend more on per capita disposable income.

FAQs.question: Does your company produce just one variety of vegetables or an array of produce?
FAQs.answer: Diversified producers will exhibit lower degrees of revenue volatility, aiding profitability.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to excess revenue volatility?
FAQs.answer: Producers that enter into long-term supply contracts with downstream customers will exhibit more stable revenue.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in proximity to key buying and selling markets?
FAQs.answer: Producers located in proximity to key selling markets will exhibit lower transportation costs and higher profitability.
